== History ==
== History ==
â
Thinstall was originally developed by Thinstall Inc. but on January 15, 2008, [[VMware]] acquired Thinstall.<ref>{{cite press release|url=http://www.vmware.com/company/news/releases/thinstall.html|title=VMware to Expand Desktop Virtualization Solution with Acquisition of Thinstall|date=January 15, 2008|accessdate=2008-06-11|publisher=[[VMware]]}}</ref> VMware later used the code name ''VMware Project North Star'' while the product was in [[Software release life cycle#Beta|beta]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://communities.vmware.com/community/beta/northstar|title=VMwareÂ® ThinApp (Project North Star/Thinstall) Release Candidate|date=June 10, 2008|accessdate=2008-06-11|publisher=[[VMware]]}}</ref> On June 10, 2008, VMware announced that the final name for the product was going to be ''VMware ThinApp''.<ref>{{cite press release|url=http://www.vmware.com/company/news/releases/thinapp_4.html|title=VMware Launches ThinApp 4.0 to Run Virtually Any Application on Any Windows Operating System without Conflict|date=June 10, 2008|accessdate=2008-06-11|publisher=[[VMware]]}}</ref> The trial version of ''Thinstall'' was initially available only to corporations<ref>[http://www.thinstall.com/products/virtualization_suite_dl.php VMware ThinApp Application Virtualization Platform: IT Management Solutions<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>, however VMware now offers a public [[Software release life cycle#Beta|trial]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.vmware.com/go/trythinapp|title=Evaluate VMware ThinApp|publisher=[[VMware]]|accessdate=2008-08-09}}</ref>
+
Thinstall was originally developed by Thinstall Inc. but on January 15, 2008, [[VMware]] acquired Thinstall.<ref>{{cite press release|url=http://www.vmware.com/company/news/releases/thinstall.html|title=VMware to Expand Desktop Virtualization Solution with Acquisition of Thinstall|date=January 15, 2008|accessdate=2008-06-11|publisher=[[VMware]]}}</ref> VMware later used the code name ''VMware Project North Star'' while the product was in [[Software release life cycle#Beta|beta]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://communities.vmware.com/community/beta/northstar|title=VMwareÂ® ThinApp (Project North Star/Thinstall) Release Candidate|date=June 10, 2008|accessdate=2008-06-11|publisher=[[VMware]]}}</ref> On June 10, 2008, VMware announced that the final name for the product was going to be ''VMware ThinApp''.<ref>{{cite press release|url=http://www.vmware.com/company/news/releases/thinapp_4.html|title=VMware Launches ThinApp 4.0 to Run Virtually Any Application on Any Windows Operating System without Conflict|date=June 10, 2008|accessdate=2008-06-11|publisher=[[VMware]]}}</ref> The trial version of ''Thinstall'' was initially available only to corporations<ref>[http://www.thinstall.com/products/virtualization_suite_dl.php VMware ThinApp Application Virtualization Platform: IT Management Solutions<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>, however VMware now offers a public trial.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.vmware.com/go/trythinapp|title=Evaluate VMware ThinApp|publisher=[[VMware]]|accessdate=2008-08-09}}</ref>
